pageContext.claim: “Social Media Giants are silencing millions of people. Can’t do this even if it means we must continue to hear Fake News like CNN, whose ratings have suffered gravely. People have to figure out what is real, and what is not, without censorship!”
pageContext.analysis: It's not clear what Trump is talking about here. Social media networks have taken steps to regulate inaccurate news reports on their platforms to the dismay of some conservatives. But they claim they have not acted improperly. As for the White House's "standing up" to these policies, Trump's economic advisor is "taking a look at" whether Google search results should be regulated after a pre-dawn presidential tweet, but no official policy or action has been announced.
